author: George Bellshaw
title: Djibril Sidibe’s decision to reject Arsenal can see him join ‘top European clubs’, says Monaco vice president
text:
Sidibe could be on his way in the summer (Picture: Getty) Monaco vice president Vadim Vasilyev has praised Djibril Sidibe’s decision to reject Arsenal and believes he can now join one of Europe’s ‘top clubs’ in the future.
The 24-year-old defender turned down a move to the Emirates before joining Monaco last summer and his decision has seen him be called up to the French national team.
He’s put in some fabulous performances with Monaco in 2016/17, scoring three times and providing five assists in 31 appearances from full-back.
And Vasilyev now believes Sidibe, who is a target for Manchester United and Chelsea, can go on to leave Monaco for bigger and better things.
He told RMC: ‘That is part of life as a turn-over club.

‘That some players come in and go out, that is part of our project.
‘Djibril Sidibé preferred Monaco to Arsenal, now he is in the French national team, and he can join the top European clubs. He deserves it.’
